title: How to Clean Silver with Coke

steps.title: Put the silver piece in a bowl or container.
steps.content: Put the silver piece in a bowl or container. Use a container large enough to hold the silver piece you’re cleaning. Make sure it’s deep enough so you can submerge the silver completely. Lay the silver on the bottom of the container. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the Coke into the container until the silver is submerged.
steps.content: Pour the Coke into the container until the silver is submerged. Make sure the silver is completely covered with the Coke. It doesn’t matter whether you use regular or Diet Coke. [2] X Research source Substitute any carbonated cola if you don’t have Coke.

steps.title: Let the silver soak for 1 hour.
steps.content: Let the silver soak for 1 hour. Leave the silver in the Coke undisturbed. The acid in the Coke will help loosen any grime and residue from the silver. If you want to leave the silver in the Coke to clean it longer, keep it submerged for up to 3 hours. [3] X Research source Check on the silver every 30 minutes to see how clean it is.

steps.title: Take the silver out of the Coke.
steps.content: Take the silver out of the Coke. Use a pair of tongs if you don’t want to get Coke on your fingers. Grab the silver and shake off any excess Coke back into the container. Set the silver on a piece of paper towel or on the table. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Use a toothbrush to scrub any remaining residue.
steps.content: Use a toothbrush to scrub any remaining residue. Work a soft-bristled toothbrush in tight circles across your piece of silver. This helps scrape off any loosened tarnish or grime that didn’t come off with the Coke. [5] X Research source Use a jewelry brush if you don’t have a spare toothbrush.

steps.title: Rinse the silver under clean water.
steps.content: Rinse the silver under clean water. Run the silver under the faucet with cool, clean water or soak it in a container full of water. Shake off the excess water so the silver isn’t wet. [6] X Research source Put a small piece of silver in a water bottle and shake it to rinse it.

steps.title: Dry the silver off with a paper towel.
steps.content: Dry the silver off with a paper towel. As soon as you pull the silver out of the water, dry it off to prevent any tarnish or rust. Make sure it’s completely dry before putting it away again. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Polish the silver with mild dish soap.
steps.content: Polish the silver with mild dish soap. Mix a few drops of mild dish soap in warm water. Dip a soft cloth into the soapy water and rub the silver clean. Rinse the silver with cold water and buff it dry. [8] X Research source
